channel.title: How the fuck
channel.description:
[s]Can I fix a faggot who keeps on nulling my server?? My fucking IP ban is shit and allows nulls even when they're ip banned, plus when I change the source to a wonderful PI, it fucks up and nobody can connect no questions asked, just does it by itself but i dont give a shit there's too many PIs out there. How do I fix this prick? I don't know when he's going to stop, but I think I've heard of a way.. where you can IP ban someone in your router or firewall? Is this true, if so tell me how? Thanks.
[code] Connection accepted from *: 63348. Fatal: Encrypted packet data length (39) different from length byte thereof (9) ClientHandler: Client null disconnected. [/code] [s]have fun with his ip if you really want it. That's what the cmd says.
ClientHandler: Client null disconnected. He isn't disconnected he just creates a null in my server I fixed anti-SYI but never anti null. I'm so tempted to chop this bastard's balls off and hang them at the top of a flagpole, i actually downloaded some virus shit from this website that installs like trojans and shit like that, and im at the point where im about to use it so he stops.. but i came to mopar please fuckin help me...[/s]
Thanks deathschaos9 ... it worked.

item.title: How the fuck
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Just close the socket when the connection is accepted.

if (connectingHost.equalsIgnoreCase("IPHERE")) { s.close(); }

If its a Delta base it goes in Server class under

String connectingHost = s.getInetAddress().getHostName();

Read full topic

item.title: How the fuck
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

conner_:

Tell your web host to block his IP on all ports, if it persists you can also block his MAC.

And how do I do that…?

Read full topic

item.title: How the fuck
item.dc:creator: @conner1 conner_
item.description:
@conner1 wrote:

Tell your web host to block his IP on all ports, if it persists you can also block his MAC.

Read full topic
